definition: to grow to adulthood/fully grown/the whole year
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: And those grownup who lose to a kid have the audacity to complaint?
sentences.chinese: 這些輸了的成年人還有臉抱怨？

sentences.english: I've spent my entire adult life doing battle with this idea.
sentences.chinese: 整個成年生活我都在和這個想法作鬥爭。

sentences.english: China Adult Constitute Standard Guide has certain applicative value.
sentences.chinese: 《中國成年人體質測定標準指南》具有應用價值。

sentences.english: There should be absolutely no behavioral tracking of minors.
sentences.chinese: 對於未成年人應該是完全沒有的行爲跟蹤的。

sentences.english: Second, adults should reappraise their priorities about what is important.
sentences.chinese: 其次，成年人應重新評估什麼事情對他們最重要。
毛蟲在成年期會變成蝴蝶。

sentences.english: Patricia Neal raised money for children and adults who had suffered brain injuries.
sentences.chinese: 帕特里夏尼爾誰提出的兒童和成年人遭受腦損傷的錢。

sentences.english: RESULTS Ischemia enhanced cell proliferation in DG of adult rats.
sentences.chinese: 結果缺血性腦損傷可促進成年大鼠齒狀回的細胞增殖。

sentences.english: The true love belongs to the adults.
sentences.chinese: 真正的愛情是屬於成年人的。

sentences.english: Now she looked a grown-up young woman.
sentences.chinese: 現在她看起來已是一個成年的姑娘了。

sentences.english: Adult males are able to mate at any time.
sentences.chinese: 成年的公犬在任何時候都可以交配。

sentences.english: Studies of adults show what's known as a baby-face bias.
sentences.chinese: 研究成年人知道什麼事娃娃臉偏見。

sentences.english: Neuronal plasticity or synaptic plasticity is maximal during brain development and still exists in adult brain.
sentences.chinese: 腦發育過程中其可塑性最強，成年腦仍具有可塑性。

sentences.english: The insult to the adult consulter results in multiplication of the faulty faucets.
sentences.chinese: 對成年諮詢者的侮辱導致有缺陷水龍頭成倍增加。

sentences.english: Madame Jolivet lives here with her grown-up son and daughter.
sentences.chinese: 朱莉維夫人和她已經成年的一兒一女住在這兒。

sentences.english: The sale of alcoholic beverages is restricted to those over 21.
sentences.chinese: 酒精飲料只能出售給21歲以上的成年人。

definition: one full year (e.g. on child's first birthday)
lit. robust years/prime of life/summer/able-bodied (fit for military service)/mature (talent, garden etc)
